archetype_name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
name: Oxtail Potjie with Samp & Beans and Warm Bread Rolls
description: Slow-cooked oxtail potjie with tomato, herbs, and paprika, served with hearty samp & beans and oven-warmed bread rolls with chakalaka on the side.
prep_steps: Light a medium braai fire for steady coals (plan for 2–3 hours of gentle heat).
Rinse and drain samp and beans.
Peel and dice onions; peel and slice carrots into thick rounds; peel and cut potatoes into large chunks; peel and crush garlic.
Measure beef stock and Chenin Blanc.
Set out bay leaves, rosemary, thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Preheat oven to 180°C for warming bread rolls later.
cook_steps: Set the potjie over steady coals. Add sunflower oil and heat until shimmering.
Brown oxtail in batches until well caramelized on all sides. Remove to a bowl.
Add onions and carrots to the potjie; cook, stirring, until softened. Add garlic and paprika; stir 30 seconds.
Deglaze with Chenin Blanc, scraping the base. Reduce by half.
Return oxtail to the pot. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, beef stock, bay leaves, rosemary, thyme, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
Bring to a gentle simmer, then cover. Cook over low, steady coals 2.5–3 hours, turning pieces occasionally, until oxtail is tender and the sauce is glossy.
After 90 minutes, add potatoes. Cover and continue cooking until potatoes are soft and the meat pulls from the bone.
While the potjie cooks, place samp and beans in a pot with plenty of water and a generous pinch of salt. Simmer on the stove until tender (about 60–90 minutes), topping up water as needed; drain.
About 10 minutes before serving, place bread rolls on a tray and warm in the oven until hot. If using butter, split and spread while warm.
Taste and adjust the potjie with salt and black pepper. Serve oxtail and sauce over or alongside the samp & beans, with warm bread rolls and chakalaka on the side.
